ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: CDD Services on behalf of Tees Esk & Wear Valleys NHS Foundation Trust

ORGANISATION.OFFICIALNAME: CDD Services on behalf of Tees Esk & Wear Valleys NHS Foundation Trust

CA_CE_CONCESSIONAIRE_PROFILE.ADDRESS: Centre For Health, Whitehouse Business Park, Peterlee

SHORT_CONTRACT_DESCRIPTION.P: Scope of the service:
A specialist secure patient transport service is required for the transport of patients for Tees Esk & Wear Valleys NHS Foundation Trust.
Secure patient transport for the purpose of this agreement is defined as follows:
— a service to transport patients that the Trust deem following a risk assessment requiring this level of transportation using the vehicle(s),
— whilst anticipating that the majority of service requirements will be within the North East of England area the Contractor is expected to cover England, Scotland and Wales,
— the successful contractor must meet all Care Quality Commission (CQC) standards national standards and must be registered with the Care Quality Commission,
— the successful contractor must satisfy the Trust requirements in relation to Patient Confidentiality and Information Security,
— the service must be available at any time of the day or night, including weekends, bank holidays and public holidays 24/7 365 days a year,
— the trust operates a “No smoking” policy to which the Contractor must comply.
Vehicles:
— all vehicles must be fit for purpose, comply with road traffic acts and local licensing authority and have appropriate insurance,

— the contractor must provide a variety of multi-purpose vehicles including covert vehicles with capacity to take up to 6 escorts with patients in a secure rear saloon and covert cell vehicles fitted with Home Office approved Cat B cell,
— vehicle checks must be carried out by the driver prior to commencing any journey,
— the contractor must have resilient contingency plans to deal with breakdowns of vehicles.
Vehicles to include the following basic layout, as a minimum:
— driver isolated in cab area from rear saloon where up to 6 passengers may be located,
— intercom system or equivalent must be in place between the driver in the cab area and passengers,
— vehicles must be able to be contacted by your organisation,
— secure area within rear saloon for patient and escort must be seated,
— access to rear area to be via side loading door. Step access to support entry/exit if required. Grab rails at both sides of door to assist with access,
— saloon to have heating system,
— vehicles to have wheelchair access and wheelchair anchoring suitable for manual and electronic wheelchairs when requested,
— vehicles must have the ability to carry oxygen,
— vehicles must have the capacity to transport patients belongings,
— vehicle must be equipped with first aid kits,
— the supplier may be required to supply vehicles that have the ability to transfer bariatric patients in excess of 25 stone.
The awarded supplier(s) shall provide the services detailed in the specification to users determined by the Trust. The journeys will commence at collection point and conclude at drop off destination.

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: The provision of specialist secure patient Transport services for the transport of patients for Tees Esk & Wear Valleys NHS Foundation Trust.
Contract period 24 months with options for a further 2 x 12 month extensions.

OPTION_DESCRIPTION.P: Initial 24 month term with the options for a further 2 x 12 month periods.

DEPOSITS_GUARANTEES_REQUIRED.P: Information will be detailed in the invitation to tender.

MAIN_FINANCING_CONDITIONS.P: Information will be detailed in the invitation to tender.

LEGAL_FORM.P: No special legal form is required, but each supplier will be required to become jointly and severally responsible for the contract before acceptance.

EXISTENCE_OTHER_PARTICULAR_CONDITIONS.P: Information will be detailed in the invitation to tender

ECONOMIC_OPERATORS_PERSONAL_SITUATION.P: In accordance with Regulation 50 of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 and as set out in the relevant contract documents and other documentation.

EAF_CAPACITY_INFORMATION.P: In accordance with Regulation 50 of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015.

T_CAPACITY_INFORMATION.P: In accordance with Regulation 50 of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015.

EXECUTION_SERVICE_RESERVED_PARTICULAR_PR.P: As detailed in the invitation to tender and supportive documents.

ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION.P: To receive more information about this opportunity, including any amendments and/or clarifications and to request any clarifications and/or to respond to this opportunity you must register your interest by using the link within the description section of this advert.
The ITT must be returned in accordance with the instructions set out in the ITT by the time and date indicated.

The contracting authority does not bind itself to accept the lowest or any offer and reserves the right to accept an offer in either whole or part. The contracting authority is not responsible for any costs incurred by the bidder in relation to the participation in this process. All figures provided in this notice are approximate.

LODGING_OF_APPEALS_PRECISION.P: The contracting authority will observe the provisions and 10 day standstill period described in the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 (PCR 2015). Unsuccessful tenderers and applicants will receive scores and reasons for the decision, including the characteristics and relative advantages of the winning bid and the reasons why the tenderer/applicant was unsuccessful. Deadlines for appeals should be in accordance with the Regulations.
